business.headline: Explained: Why Zomato share price plunged over 5% todayZomato stock price: Shares of the company have been under pressure ever since global brokerage firm Jefferies raised concerns over rising competition in the quick commerce space.

India 1st G20 country to achieve Paris Agreement goals, says PM Narendra ModiPrime Minister Narendra Modi also outlined various other green energy targets to achieve by the year 2030, calling them ambitious yet possible given the excellent track record in the past 10 years.

Why Eicher Motors shares dropped 7% despite record Royal Enfield sales in Q3Eicher Motors stock price fell nearly 7% in early trade despite reporting a 18% year-on-year rise in consolidated net profit.

Nokia picks Intel's AI and data centre leader Justin Hotard as new CEOJustin Hotard, who will take up the position on April 1, is currently the executive vice president and general manager of Data Center & AI Group at Intel, according to the chipmaker's website.
Stock market sell-off hurting your portfolio? Here's what you can doThe ongoing stock market sell-off has hit retail investors hard, dragging portfolios deep into the red.

Sensex falls nearly 200 points, Nifty struggles in early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 197.45 points to 77,114.35 at 9:29 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 62.90 points to trade at 23,318.70. All the other broader market indices were also trading in negative territory.

Own more than 1 property? Why you don't need to worry about additional taxThe reform announced in Budget 2025 regarding two self-occupied properties would encourage investment across the country's real-estate segment and would also enhance affordability for homebuyers.
Bears rampage Dalal Street as Sensex, Nifty close lower on US tariff fearsThe BSE Sensex dropped 548.79 points to close at 77,311.80, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 178.35 points to end at 23,381.60.

Explained: Why you shouldn't stop investing despite opting for new tax regime Tax-savings incentives like the Public Provident Fund (PPF), National Savings Certificate (NSC) and Equity-Linked Savings Scheme (ELSS) not only helped individuals lower their taxes but also induced disciplined savings habits, particularly among young people in developing financial prudence early in their careers.
Edelweiss MF CEO Radhika Gupta on SIPs: 'Don't fall for fear-mongering'Radhika Gupta reiterated that patience and a long-term approach are essential for SIP investors.

Markets bleed as investors lose Rs 6 lakh crore: Will the fall continue? The fall in the stock market led to a loss of Rs 6 lakh crore in investor wealth as market bulls took control of the Dalal Street.

When will your home, auto loan EMIs get cheaper after RBI rate cut?Experts say that borrowers with repo rate-linked loans will see an immediate or near-term reduction, while those with MCLR-linked loans may have to wait longer.

UPI fraud on the rise: 5 scams you must watch out forFraudsters often at times impersonate banks or organisations and trick victims to reveal sensitive information like UPI account, OTP and PIN details.

New income tax regime: Check revised tax rates, slabs, and will you benefit? Will the new tax regime put more money in your pocket, or should you stick with the old regime? Here is all you need to know.

Rupee hits all-time low of 87.94 against US dollarThe rupee slumped to a new all-time low of 87.95 per US dollar on Monday as fears over potential US trade tariffs rattled regional currencies. This surpasses last week's record of 87.5825. The currency was last trading at 87.9325, marking a 0.6% decline for the day.

Gautam Adani donates Rs 10,000 crore for social causes at younger son's weddingSources close to billionaire Gautam Adani said the Rs 10,000 crore donation will go into the creation of a network of affordable world-class hospitals and medical colleges and advanced global skill academics with assured employability.

Sensex tanks over 600 points: 3 reasons why stock market is falling todayThe BSE Sensex lost over 600 points, while the NSE Nifty dropped close to 200 points in early trade. The Sensex fell to the day's low of 77,189.04 after closing at 77,860.19 in the previous session.

Sensex, Nifty tumble as rupee hits record low; metal, energy stocks dragThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 394.07 points to 77,466.12, while the NSE Niftt50 fell by 130.10 points to 23,429.85 as of 9:40 AM.

Rupee crashes 44 paise to all-time low of 87.94 against US dollarIn early trade, the rupee weakened to 87.95 per U.S. dollar, surpassing its previous record low of 87.5825 from last week. It was last trading at 87.9325, down 0.6% for the day.

Ajax Engineering IPO open for bidding: Should you subscribe? Check GMPAjax Engineering IPO opens for subscription: The bidding process will close on February 12, 2025. Before the IPO opened for public subscription, Ajax Engineering raised Rs 379.32 crore from anchor investors.

entertainment.headline: Rakhi Sawant asks forgiveness for Ranveer AllahbadiaActor Rakhi Sawant shared a message for fans amid the Ranveer Allahbadia controversy. She requested all to 'forgive' the YouTuber for his recent crass jokes on Samay Raina's show.

Sanya Malhotra's Mrs should come with a trigger warning. Here's whyMrs, starring Sanya Malhotra, explores patriarchal society and the struggles of women in arranged marriages. Here's why this movie should be on your watchlist if you have not watched it yet.

Singer Charlie Puth to Kanye West for selling Swastika T-shirts: I beg you to stopSinger Charlie Puth 'begged' Kanye West to stop after he sold Swastika T-shirts on his website. Kanye's move sparked concern about his 'incredibly dangerous' claims.

Ankita Lokhande tears down Rozlyn Khan's claims about Hina Khan's cancer: So cheapAnkita Lokhande slammed Rozlyn Khan for her claims about Hina Khan's cancer battle. She called out Rozlyn Khan's claims 'cheap'.

Bryan Adams's Australia concert cancelled due to overflowing sewageSinger Bryan Adams's Australia concert was cancelled due to an overflowing sewage issue caused by a "large blockage" of fat, grease, and rags. Adams apologised to fans and assured them that tickets would be refunded.

Arijit Singh takes Ed Sheeran on scooter ride in his hometown in West Bengal. WatchSinger Arijit Singh took pop singer Ed Sheeran on a scooter ride in West Bengal's Jiaganj. The English singer-songwriter ditched heavy security and enjoyed his ride through the streets of West Bengal.

Comedian Kapil Sharma meets Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Mohan YadavKapil Sharma met Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Mohan Yadav in Bhopal and shared glimpses of their meeting on social media. He also expressed his gratitude.

BB 18's Chum Darang shares cryptic post after Elvish Yadav's racist remarksChum Darang shared a cryptic post on Instagram, advocating for respect and equality. This came after Elvish Yadav made racist remarks about her.

Decoding Grammy winner Kendrick Lamar's Superbowl half-time performanceKendrick Lamar became the first rapper to headline the Super Bowl solo, marking a major milestone in his career. The performance, featuring SZA and a memorable moment with Serena Williams, somewhat sparked debate on social media.

Jeetendra Kumar aka Jeetu Bhaiya on love, Panchayat, Gen-Z, Kota Factory and IITActor Jeetendra Kumar, popularly known by his screen name, Jeetu Bhaiya from Kota Factory, spoke in an exclusive interview with India Today Digital, about the time when he, for the first time, tasted success. He also discussed his famous roles - Sachiv ji and Jeetu Bhaiya, and mentioned his idea of love and whether he agrees with the Gen-Z and 'situation-ships'.

Anaganaga: First look poster of Sumanth-starrer out, film to release on OTTSumanth, the eldest grandson of Akkineni Nageswara Rao, is set to star in Anaganaga. The first look poster was shared on the actor's birthday and it is set to release directly on OTT.

Newtopia review: Jisoo, Park Jeong-Min's zombie apocalypse romance is refreshingReleased-Fri Feb 07, 2025Newtopia review: Jisoo and Park Jeong-Min bring a fresh twist to the zombie apocalypse genre in Newtopia. Set in post-apocalyptic Seoul, the series focusses on love and humour amidst chaos.

The Mehta Boys: A beautifully crafted film about family, memories and unspoken bondsBoman Irani made his directorial debut with The Mehta Boys. The film, starring Irani himself and Avinash Tiwary, offers a deep understanding of relationships in modern India.

Sanya Malhotra's Mrs clips sparks debate, women say it mirrors real-life strugglesCertain clips from Sanya Malhotra's latest release, Mrs, have shocked the internet with several fans expressing their outrage in the comments section.

Podcaster Ranveer Allahbadia apologises for crass jokes: Hope you can forgive mePodcaster Ranveer Allahbadia apologised for making obscene jokes on Samay Raina's India's Got Latent. In a video statement, he expressed regret over his remarks and vowed to use his platform more responsibly in the future.

Sonu Nigam gets angry at fans in Kolkata: If you want to stand, contest in electionsSinger Sonu Nigam's performance in Kolkata faced unexpected audience disruptions. The singer was compelled to address crowd control issues to ensure smooth proceedings.

Kendrick Lamar performs with Drake's ex Serena Williams at Super Bowl, fans reactIn a surprise act, singer and rapper Drake's former girlfriend Serena Williams joined Kendrick Lamar during his Super Bowl LIX half-time performance, sending the internet into a frenzy. The tennis legend also shared a clip of her performance on social media.

Taylor Swift shocked after Eagles fans boo her at Super BowlTaylor Swift, the renowned pop star, faced an unexpected reaction from Eagles fans during her appearance at Super Bowl LIX. The unexpected boos left her and many others wondering about the cause.

Internet slams Ranveer Allahbadia over obscene jokes on Samay Raina's showYouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia finds himself in hot water after making inappropriate jokes and comments on Samay Raina's India's Got Latent. An FIR has been filed against Ranveer, Samay and those who were present as the judges for the episode.

Watch: Ed Sheeran, Shilpa Rao wow Bengaluru fans with Telugu hit ChuttamalleSinger Ed Sheeran surprised fans during his Bengaluru concert after he sang the Telugu hit track, Chuttamalle, with Shilpa Rao. He shared the video on social media and expressed his happiness at learning a new language.

general news.headline: Parliament heat on Ranveer Allahabadia, panel summons likely over vulgar jokeParliamentary committee may summon Ranveer Allahabadia over obscene joke on Samay Raina's show: Sources

Elon Musk offers $97 billion to buy OpenAI, Sam Altman rejectsElon Musk with a few more investors proposed a buyout offer of $97 billion to OpenAI CEO Sam Altman. But, Altman rejected the proposal, saying "no thank you".

Ahead of AI Summit, PM meets 'friend' Macron, greets JD Vance at Paris dinnerIn a bid to strengthen AI governance, the Paris Summit aims to focus on a global governance model to make artificial intelligence more inclusive while ensuring safe and transparent AI for users across the world.

The hole new world of Rahul Gandhi's CongressThe BJP won the Delhi elections, the AAP lost, and the Congress didn't even start. Yet, the Congress is jubilant that Prime Minister Narendra Modi did not beat the AAP, the AAP beat itself up.

How and where Indian Metro is adding 1000km to become world No. 2While viral fights and dance videos on our Metro trains steal the spotlight, India's metro is silently rewriting the record books. India has 1,000 km of metro network across 17 cities, and is adding another 1,000 km to it. This is where and how the country is adding metro lines to overtake the US as the world's second-biggest Metro network.

Trump suspends US Foreign Corruption Act; glimmer of hope for Gautam Adani?The potential impact of Trump's suspension of Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (FCPA) enforcement is significant, particularly for companies like the Adani Group.

Video: Indian restaurants targetted in UK's Trump-style blitz on illegal migrantsThe UK government has launched a countrywide "blitz" aimed at removing illegal migrants employed in Indian restaurants, nail bars, convenience stores and car washes.

YouTube removes Ranveer Allahbadia's obscene jokes video after Centre's noticeRanveer Allahbadia, popularly known for his BeerBiceps channel on YouTube, has been widely criticised for his obscene jokes on comedian Samay Raina's 'India's Got Latent' show, with multiple complaints being filed against him alleging vulgarity.

Sanya Malhotra's Mrs should come with a trigger warning. Here's whyMrs, starring Sanya Malhotra, explores patriarchal society and the struggles of women in arranged marriages. Here's why this movie should come with a trigger warning and must be on your watchlist.

Delhi Elections: A masterclass in strategy by Team ModiIn Haryana, Maharashtra, and now in Delhi, Narendra Modi personally ensured that the miffed karyakarta came back to trudge the streets, knock on the doors, man the booths, and unobtrusively spread the message while keeping the faith.

Joint op to arrest AAP's Amanatullah Khan for 'helping' criminal escape copsA case has been filed against AAP's Okhla MLA Amanatullah Khan for interrupting a police operation in Jamia, leading to the escape of a wanted criminal.

Unrest in Mysuru as morphed images of Rahul Gandhi go viral, cops fire tear gasAn offensive social media post involving morphed images of Arvind Kejriwal, Rahul Gandhi and Akhilesh Yadav with words in Arabic script allegedly meant to hurt Muslim sentiments sparked tensions in Mysuru, Karnataka.

As Trump fires the penny, here's how India's one-rupee coin is holding upUS President Donald Trump has ordered a halt to the minting of pennies, the coins denoting a cent of the dollar, over high production costs. The minting cost of India's Re 1 coin is also more than its face value. However, the 'ek rupiya ka sikka' holds ground and has high relevance in everyday transactions and traditions.

Back with a bang! 2025 is officially the year of fringesWith nods from the likes of Miley Cyrus, Lady Gaga, and Shraddha Kapoor, bangs (also called fringes) are set to rule 2025 and shed their stereotypical "trauma bangs" image.

India to launch fruit flies to space aboard Gaganyaan MissionThe fruit flies will be used to assess how space travel affects living organisms and what kind of biological changes and stresses they go through during the flight.

Tom Cruise's 'punishing' Mission Impossible stunt had him breathe carbon dioxideTom Cruise said he breathed his own carbon dioxide for the underwater stunt in Mission: Impossible - The Final Reckoning. The film's director called it 'physically punishing'.

Bhagwant Mann, Punjab MLAs arrive in Delhi for big AAP meet after Delhi routArvind Kejriwal called for the meeting just days after his Aam Aadmi Party faced a crushing defeat in the Delhi Assembly elections, with the BJP securing a thumping victory by winning 48 seats.

Release all hostages by Saturday or will let hell break out: Trump warns HamasUS President Donald Trump warned he would push to end the Israel-Hamas ceasefire if all hostages were not released by Saturday. Hamas stopped hostage releases, citing Israeli violations, raising concerns the deal could collapse.

Arijit Singh takes Ed Sheeran on scooter ride in his hometown in West Bengal. WatchSinger Arijit Singh took pop singer Ed Sheeran on a scooter ride in West Bengal's Jiaganj. The English singer-songwriter ditched heavy security and enjoyed his ride through the streets of West Bengal.

Ranveer Allahbadia controversy: When does a joke stop being funny?A viral clip from India's Got Latent has landed Ranveer Allahbadia, Samay Raina, and others in legal trouble, sparking intense online debate - what is freedom of speech, and how far can you take a joke?

Gulf of America or Gulf of Mexico? One place, two names on Google MapsGoogle Maps officially changed the name of Gulf of Mexico to Gulf of America, but only for users in America. In Mexico, the name remains the same.

7 Kumbh returnees killed after their vehicle collides with truck in Madhya PradeshAt least seven Maha Kumbh pilgrims from Andhra Pradesh died after their tempo traveller hit a truck in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur district. An investigation is on to determine the cause of the crash.
Stock market sell-off hurting your portfolio? Here's what you can doThe ongoing stock market sell-off has hit retail investors hard, dragging portfolios deep into the red.

Chhaava advance booking: Vicky's film set for Bollywood's best opening in 2025Chhaava, starring Vicky Kaushal and Rashmika Mandanna, is doing good business in advance booking. With two more days to go for the film's release, it is expected to register the biggest opening for a Bollywood film this year so far.

Shiva Shiva Shankaraa: Kannappa's first song is a devotional anthemShiva Shiva Shankaraa, the first single of Vishnu Manchu's upcoming Telugu film Kannappa, was released. Also starring Akshay Kumar and Prabhas in cameos, the mythological film will release in April 2025.

Sanam Teri Kasam re-release box office Day 4: Harshvardhan's film on a smashing runHarshvardhan Rane and Mawra Hocane's Sanam Teri Kasam is doing fabulous business during its second innings at the box office. The film has already surpassed the new Bollywood releases, and is looking at a promising weekday collection ahead.

Telugu filmmakers, actors address piracy crisis: Arrests will be made soonThe Telugu film industry is grappling with a resurgence of piracy, impacting box office earnings of top-grossing films like Pushpa 2 and Kalki 2898 AD. Filmmakers and actors are urging audiences to support cinemas and discourage illegal distribution.

sports.headline: Fit-again Djokovic ready for Qatar Open comeback in February, eyes 100th title24-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic, chasing his 100th title on the tour, confirmed he will return to action in Qatar Open, starting February 17. The Serb withdrew midway during his Australian Open semi-final due to an injury.

Watch: Ellyse Perry shakes off injury doubts, reaches RCB base in 'Stone Cold' styleEllyse Perry has shaken off injury doubts and has arrived at the Royal Challengers Bengaluru base ahead of the start of the Women's Premier League 2025 season. Perry played a vital role in RCB's title win last season.

Ranji Trophy quarters: Rahane hits hundred to celebrate special 200 in style Ranji Trophy 2024-25: Ajinkya Rahane celebrated his 200th first-class appearance by hitting a match-defining hundred against Haryana in the quarter-final at Eden Gardens in Kolkata.

IND vs ENG: India, England reach Ahmedabad ahead of 3rd and final ODIIndia and England reached Ahmedabad ahead of the 3rd and final ODI of the series on Monday, January 10. Both teams will be aiming for the win as they look to step up their preparations for the Champions Trophy 2025. India already won the series with their victory during the Cuttack ODI.

Saim Ayub-less Pakistan face stiff challenge to end barren run   Champions Trophy 2025 Preview: Pakistan have done well recently under Mohammad Rizwan's captaincy, but having not won an ICC title since 2017, they will be under pressure to put up a good show in front of their home crowd.

Constant spotlight on Virat Kohli is quite unnecessary: Arjuna RanatungaFormer Sri Lankan captain Arjuna Ranatunga feels that the constant spotlight on Virat Kohli is unnecessary as the Indian star struggles to find form with the bat. Kohli scored just 5 runs in the Cuttack ODI.

SL vs AUS ODIs: Vandersay in, Wickramasinghe out as Sri Lanka name strong squad Sri Lanka have brought back Jeffrey Vandersay and decided to leave out Chamindu Wickramasinghe as they named a strong squad for the upcoming ODI series against Australia, starting on February 12.

Mumbai Indians acquire 49 per cent stake in Oval Invincibles Mumbai Indians, through its subsidiary, RISE, claimed a 49 per cent stake in The Oval Invincibles, the most successful team in the history of the Hundred. The MI franchise recently tasted success after MI Cape Town won the SA20 2025.

Shardul eyes Test return in England, open to playing County after IPL snubAll-rounder Shardul Thakur is eyeing India comeback in the tour of England, set to be held in the months of June and July. Shardul has been in sensational form in the Ranji Trophy with both bat and ball in the last 2 seasons.

Ranji Trophy: Shardul knocks on selectors' doors, Suryakumar and Rahane shineRanji Trophy quarterfinal: Mumbai rode on Shardul Thakur's heroic six-wicket haul to secure a crucial first innings lead against Haryana in Kolkata. Captain Ajinkya Rahane and Suryakumar Yadav shone with the bat in the second innings to stretch the defending champions' lead.

Gambhir, you're not being fair to KL Rahul: Ex-captain upset over ODI experimentsIndia vs England: KL Rahul gave up his favourite batting spot to accommodate Axar Patel, who was promoted by the team management to bat at No. 5 in the first two ODIs. While Axar made good use of the opportunities, Rahul failed with the bat in Nagpur and Cuttack.

Find Hardik Pandya's game enjoyable, our playing styles are similar: Mithila Vinod India U19 Women's cricketer Mithila Vinod, in an exclusive interview with India Today Digital, said that she admires Hardik Pandya and finds her style of playing similar to that of the senior men's all-rounder. Mithila recently was a part of the Indian team that won the U19 Women's T20 World Cup in Malaysia.

Why is KL Rahul batting at No.6? Former selector questions Gambhir's strategyKL Rahul batting behind Axar Patel in the Indian line-up has baffled many. A former national selector has hit out against Gautam Gambhir's move which has affected KL Rahul's runs in the ODI format.

Williamson overshadows Breetzke, fires New Zealand to tri-series final Kane Williamson scored 133 runs off 113 balls as New Zealand beat Temba Bavuma's South Africa by six wickets at the Gaddafi Stadium to reach the final of the ODI tri-series on Pakistani soil.

Ravi Shastri backs dangerous Pakistan to reach Champions Trophy semi-finalFormer India head coach Ravi Shastri feels that Pakistan can be very dangerous side in home conditions. Shastri and Ricky Ponting have backed the side to reach the semi-final of the Champions Trophy 2025.

ODI tri-series: Kane Williamson equals AB de Villiers after hitting 47th centuryNew Zealand vs South Africa, ODI tri-series: Kane Williamson hit a 72-ball hundred, leading New Zealand's chase in the second match of a tri-series in Lahore on Monday, February 10.

Jasprit Bumrah for Champions Trophy? Deadline day decision on cards, says reportJasprit Bumrah's availability for the Champions Trophy is under clouds. According to reports, the Indian team will take a call on Bumrah on February 11, the last day to make changes in squads for the ICC tournament.

Kohli urges fans to join organ donation initiative during Ahmedabad ODI  IND vs ENG: Virat Kohli urged fans to join the organ donation initiative when India and England face off in the third and final ODI of the three-match series on Wednesday, February 12.

If Rohit Sharma clicks, India will win Champions Trophy: Mohammed AzharuddinMohammed Azharuddin has claimed that if Rohit Sharma clicks, India will win the Champions Trophy 2025. Rohit came back into form with a blazing hundred against England in the second ODI in Cuttack.

South Africa's Matthew Breetzke sets new world record with 150 on ODI debutSouth Africa vs New Zealand in Pakistan: Opener Matthew Breetzke became the first man to hit 150 on his debut in a one-day international match. Breetzke broke West Indies great Desmond Haynes's record.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
